channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Covid vaccine and test passes to be introduced in Wales
item.description: People will need to show they have been vaccinated or had a negative test for clubs and large events.

item.title: Reid Steele: Toddler died after being 'submerged in water'
item.description: An inquest into the death of a two year old has been opened.

item.title: Covid: Wife calls for Wales-inquiry after husband's suicide
item.description: Running a care home during the pandemic contributed to Vernon Hough's suicide, his widow says.

item.title: Denbigh: Hopes and fears over abandoned asylum flats plans
item.description: Plans to restore the building have been welcomed, but some fear homes will place pressure on services.

item.title: Campaign to halt development of Carmarthenshire quarry
item.description: About 600 people have signed a petition to protect "one of the most beautiful parts of Wales".

item.title: Wrexham woman, 98, confronts three men in 'sickening' burglary
item.description: She challenged the burglars and after a "brief confrontation", they escaped empty handed.

item.title: Cardiff Indoor Arena: World-class venue set to attract jobs and visitors
item.description: Backers say the "world-class" 15,000-capacity venue would attract one million people a year.

item.title: Machen: Biker Ian Edwards dies after being hit by a car
item.description: Ian Edwards, 50, was pronounced dead at the scene and his family are being supported.

item.title: Dating site fraud: Rhyl barber jailed for £90,000 con
item.description: Esosa Eromosele is sentenced to 18 months after conning money from women online.

item.title: Swansea man jailed after CCTV operator witnessed rape
item.description: Turkey Al-Turkey is sentenced to eight years and eight months for raping a woman in Swansea.

item.title: Green Man 20th anniversary sold out 11 months before festival
item.description: Mercury prize winner Michael Kiwanuka is confirmed for Welsh festival's 20th anniversary event.

item.title: Electric cars a danger to the blind, say charities
item.description: One man says he often has near-misses and would have been hurt if it was not for his guide dog.

item.title: Covid: Care homes were on their own, says widow
item.description: Running a care home during the pandemic contributed to Vernon Hough's suicide, his widow says.

item.title: Disused Carmarthenshire quarry 'needs to be protected'
item.description: There are fears wildlife will be harmed if a recycling faciity is developed at the site.

item.title: Electric cars: 'People with sight loss are in danger'
item.description: Blind and visually impaired people say quiet hybrid and electric vehicles put their lives in danger.

item.title: Covid: Doctor combating jab myths called Dr Death by trolls
item.description: Dr Bnar Talabani uses social media to dispel vaccine misinformation.

item.title: Care home owners fear legal action over Covid could cause bankruptcy
item.description: Care home owners fear homes could face closure without the same protection from claims as the NHS.

item.title: Gleision: 'Guilt of surviving mine disaster with me forever'
item.description: A decade on from the Gleision mine disaster, two men who survived still carry the weight of the tragedy.

item.title: Women's World Cup qualifier: Wales v Kazakhstan
item.description: Preview followed by live coverage of Friday's Women's World Cup Qualifying game between Wales and Kazakhstan Women.

item.title: Welsh sports fans will need to show Covid passes from October
item.description: Sport fans will need to show a pass proving they have been fully vaccinated or had a negative Covid test to attend large-scale events in Wales from 11 October.

item.title: Rubin Colwill: Fellow Cardiff City midfielder will benefit from up and down week, says Marlon Pack
item.description: Cardiff City midfielder Marlon Pack believes teenager Rubin Colwill will benefit from "the trials and tribulations of Championship football".

item.title: Mark Allen: Swansea City 'absolutely delighted' with Russell Martin's style of football
item.description: Sporting director Mark Allen says he is "absolutely delighted" with the style of football Russell Martin is trying to play at Swansea City.

item.title: Rhys Webb: Wales ambition still burns brightly for Ospreys scrum-half
item.description: Ospreys and British and Irish Lions scrum-half Rhys Webb says he retains his ambition to play for Wales.

item.title: Cyflwyno 'pasbort Covid' yng Nghymru o fis nesaf
item.description: Bydd angen i bobl dros 18 oed ddangos prawf o fod wedi cael brechlyn neu brawf negatif er mwyn mynd i rai lleoliadau.

item.title: Bachgen dwy oed wedi marw ar ôl cael ei foddi
item.description: Cafodd Reid Steele ei ddarganfod gan ei nain yn anymwybodol ar lawr ystafell ymolchi ei gartref.

item.title: 'Angen atebion' am benderfyniadau'r pandemig
item.description: Gwraig perchennog cartref gofal a laddodd ei hun y llynedd yn galw am ymchwiliad ar wahân i Gymru.

item.title: Camu i fyd hudol gyda'r swynwraig Mhara Starling
item.description: Gwneud bywoliaeth allan o chwedloniaeth a thraddodiadau paganaidd Cymru.

item.title: Cwpan y Byd Merched 2023: Ai dyma'r ymgyrch i Gymru?
item.description: Dyma'r cwestiwn oedd ar wefusau pawb wrth holi'r chwaraewyr yr wythnos hon, medd Owain Llyr.
